page.title: 14BURGHFIELD COM'N-LEISURE 1
page.content: In a growing community such as this village,there is bound to be great pressure on the amenities.However, whilst the nearest arts and sports complexes are eight miles away in Reading,the village succeeds in pro- viding activities for all ages. For the very young,there are the pop- ular Brownies,Bevers and Cubs,and dur- ing the summer,the Burghfield ,Ufton and Mortimer Play Scheme (BUMPS) is run at the Willink School.Older Child- ren can attend local dancing or riding classes,aswell as the local Scout and Guide movements.Discos are common. For the energetic,the "Burgfield 10" road-race is held annually,and there are also cricket and football teams. The Volunteer Bureau provides activ- ities for the older members of the community,and a Day Centre at Bland's Court also provides facilities.
